title: Tender Coconut Ice Cream
instructions: Blend tender coconut water and flesh in a blender until smooth.
Add sugar and cardamom powder to the mixture and blend again.
In a separate bowl, mix the blended coconut with milk and cream.
Pour the mixture into a container and freeze for 1 hour.
Stir the mixture well, then return to the freezer.
Repeat stirring every 30 minutes for the next 2-3 hours until creamy and set.

title: Jackfruit Ice Cream
instructions: Blend ripe jackfruit pulp with sugar until smooth.
Add cardamom powder and mix well.
Combine with milk and cream in a mixing bowl.
Pour the mixture into a container and freeze for 1 hour.
Stir the mixture every 30 minutes for the next 2-3 hours until it becomes creamy and smooth.

title: Banana Ice Cream
instructions: Mash ripe bananas until smooth.
Blend mashed bananas with sugar, milk, cream, and vanilla essence.
Pour the mixture into a container and freeze for 1 hour.
Stir well every 30 minutes for the next 2-3 hours until firm and creamy.

title: Filter Coffee Ice Cream
instructions: Brew strong filter coffee and allow it to cool completely.
Mix the coffee with sugar, milk, and cream.
Add cardamom powder and stir well.
Pour into a container and freeze for 1 hour.
Stir the mixture every 30 minutes for the next 2-3 hours until creamy and set.

title: Mango Kulfi
instructions: Mix mango pulp, condensed milk, milk, sugar, and cardamom powder in a large bowl.
Whisk until smooth and well combined.
Pour into kulfi molds or a freezer-safe container.
Freeze until firm (6–8 hours or overnight).
Garnish with chopped pistachios before serving.

title: Palm Fruit (Taal) Ice Cream
instructions: Blend palm fruit pulp with sugar until smooth.
Mix with milk and cream in a bowl.
Add cardamom powder and stir until well combined.
Freeze the mixture, stirring every 30 minutes for 2–3 hours until creamy.

title: Coconut Jaggery Ice Cream
instructions: In a pan, cook grated coconut with jaggery until melted and well combined.
Allow the mixture to cool completely.
Mix with milk, cream, and cardamom powder.
Freeze, stirring occasionally for 2–3 hours until set and creamy.

title: Fig & Honey Ice Cream
instructions: Soak dried figs in warm water until soft, then blend into a paste.
Mix fig paste with honey, milk, cream, and vanilla essence.
Pour into a container and freeze for 1 hour.
Stir every 30 minutes for 2–3 hours until creamy.

title: Rosemilk Ice Cream
instructions: Mix rose syrup, milk, cream, sugar, and cardamom powder in a bowl.
Stir until the sugar dissolves completely.
Freeze the mixture, stirring every 30 minutes for 2–3 hours until creamy and set.

title: Mysore Pak
instructions: Grease a plate or tray and set aside.
In a pan, heat sugar and water to make a sugar syrup of one-string consistency.
Add the gram flour to the syrup and mix well to avoid lumps.
Slowly add ghee in small portions while continuously stirring.
Keep stirring and cooking on low heat until the mixture thickens and starts to leave the sides of the pan.
Pour the mixture onto the greased plate and spread evenly.
Allow it to cool slightly and then cut into pieces.
Let it cool completely before serving.

title: Rava Kesari
instructions: Heat ghee in a pan and fry cashew nuts and raisins until golden. Set aside.
In the same pan, roast the semolina on medium heat until aromatic, without browning.
Boil water in a separate pot with saffron strands.
Slowly add the hot water to the roasted semolina while stirring to avoid lumps.
Cook on low heat until the semolina absorbs all the water and thickens.
Add sugar and mix well; the mixture will become liquidy again.
Keep stirring until it thickens again.
Add cardamom powder, fried cashews, and raisins; mix well.
Turn off heat and cover for a few minutes before serving.

title: Boondi Ladoo
instructions: Make a smooth batter by mixing gram flour with water.
Heat ghee or oil in a deep frying pan.
Pour batter through a perforated ladle or spoon to make small droplets into the hot oil.
Fry the boondi (small fried balls) until golden and crisp; drain and set aside.
In a pan, prepare sugar syrup by boiling sugar and water until one-string consistency is reached.
Add cardamom powder and saffron strands to the syrup.
Mix the fried boondi into the syrup quickly and turn off the heat.
Allow the mixture to cool slightly, then shape into round ladoos using greased hands.
Let the ladoos cool completely and set before serving.

title: Obbattu (Puran Poli)
instructions: Cook chana dal in water until soft, then drain excess water.
Mash the cooked dal and cook it again with jaggery until the mixture thickens.
Add cardamom powder and mix well; let it cool.
Make a dough with wheat flour, oil, and water; knead until smooth.
Divide the dough and filling into equal portions.
Roll out a dough ball, place filling in the center, seal, and gently roll into a thin circle.
Cook on a hot griddle, applying ghee on both sides until golden brown spots appear.
Serve warm with ghee or milk.

title: Ariselu
instructions: Heat jaggery and water until the jaggery dissolves completely to form a syrup.
Add sesame seeds to the syrup and mix well.
Add rice flour gradually to the syrup to form a soft dough.
Divide the dough into small balls and flatten them into discs.
Heat ghee in a pan and fry the discs on medium heat until golden on both sides.
Drain excess ghee and let them cool before serving.

title: Kozhukattai (Modak)
instructions: Boil water with a pinch of salt and 1 teaspoon ghee.
Add rice flour gradually while stirring to avoid lumps and make a soft dough.
In another pan, cook grated coconut with jaggery and cardamom powder until the mixture thickens.
Divide the dough into small balls, flatten them, and fill with the coconut-jaggery mixture.
Seal the edges and shape into modak (dumpling) shape.
Steam the modaks for 10-15 minutes until cooked.
Serve warm with ghee.

title: Unniyappam
instructions: Dissolve jaggery in water to make syrup and strain.
Mix rice flour, grated coconut, mashed banana, cardamom powder, and jaggery syrup to form a batter.
Heat ghee or oil in a special unniyappam pan.
Pour spoonfuls of batter into each mold and fry until golden brown on all sides.
Remove and drain on paper towels.
Serve warm.

title: Adhirasam
instructions: Heat jaggery and water until jaggery dissolves completely to form a syrup.
Mix rice flour and cardamom powder into the syrup to form a dough.
Let the dough rest overnight.
Next day, make small balls and flatten them into discs.
Heat oil or ghee in a pan and deep fry the discs until golden brown on both sides.
Drain excess oil and cool before serving.

title: Badusha
instructions: Mix flour, semolina, yogurt, and ghee to form a soft dough; let it rest for 15-20 minutes.
Divide dough into small balls and flatten slightly with a fork pattern on top.
Heat oil and deep fry on medium heat until golden and cooked through.
In another pan, prepare sugar syrup with sugar and water until one-string consistency.
Dip the fried badushas into warm sugar syrup briefly and remove.
Serve once they absorb the syrup and cool.

title: Semiya Payasam (Vermicelli Kheer)
instructions: Heat ghee in a pan and roast the cashew nuts until golden brown. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, roast the raisins until they puff up. Remove and set aside.
Add vermicelli to the pan and roast until golden brown.
Pour in water and cook the vermicelli until it softens.
Add milk and bring the mixture to a boil.
Reduce the heat and simmer for 5-7 minutes.
Add sugar and stir until it dissolves completely.
Sprinkle cardamom powder and mix well.
Garnish with roasted cashew nuts and raisins before serving.

title: Paruppu Payasam (Moong Dal Kheer)
instructions: Dry roast moong dal in a pan until aromatic.
Wash the roasted dal and pressure cook with water until soft.
In a separate pan, melt jaggery with a little water to make syrup. Strain to remove impurities.
Add the jaggery syrup to the cooked dal and mix well.
Pour in milk and simmer the mixture for 5-7 minutes.
Add cardamom powder and stir.
Heat ghee in a pan, fry cashew nuts and raisins until golden, and add to the payasam.
Serve warm or chilled.

title: Palada Pradhaman
instructions: Boil water and soak rice ada for 10 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water.
Boil milk in a heavy-bottomed pan.
Add the soaked ada to the boiling milk and cook until soft.
Stir in sugar and continue to cook until it dissolves.
Add cardamom powder and mix well.
Heat ghee in a pan, fry cashew nuts and raisins until golden, and add to the pradhaman.
Serve warm or chilled.

title: Chakkara Pongal (Sweet Pongal)
instructions: Dry roast moong dal until aromatic.
Wash rice and roasted dal together.
Cook rice and dal with water in a pressure cooker until soft.
In a separate pan, melt jaggery with a little water to make syrup. Strain to remove impurities.
Add the jaggery syrup to the cooked rice-dal mixture and mix well.
Add cardamom powder and stir.
Heat ghee in a pan, fry cashew nuts and raisins until golden, and add to the pongal.
Serve warm.

title: Kadalai Maavu Halwa (Besan Halwa)
instructions: Heat ghee in a pan and roast besan on low flame until aromatic and golden.
Gradually add milk, stirring continuously to avoid lumps.
Add sugar and continue to stir until the mixture thickens.
Add cardamom powder and mix well.
Garnish with roasted cashew nuts.
Serve warm.

title: Elaneer Payasam (Tender Coconut Kheer)
instructions: Blend tender coconut pulp with coconut water to a smooth paste.
In a pan, mix milk, condensed milk, and sugar. Bring to a boil and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add the blended coconut mixture to the milk and mix well.
Add cardamom powder and stir.
Chill the payasam before serving.

title: Banana Halwa
instructions: Mash the ripe bananas to a smooth paste.
In a pan, melt jaggery with a little water to make syrup. Strain to remove impurities.
Add the banana paste to the jaggery syrup and cook on low flame.
Add ghee gradually while stirring continuously.
Cook until the mixture thickens and leaves the sides of the pan.
Add cardamom powder and mix well.
Garnish with roasted cashew nuts.
Allow to cool and set before cutting into pieces.

title: Paal Payasam (Milk Kheer)
instructions: Wash the raw rice thoroughly and soak it in water for 30 minutes.
Drain the rice and grind it coarsely or crush it lightly.
In a heavy-bottomed pan, bring the milk to a boil.
Add the crushed rice to the boiling milk and reduce the heat to low.
Simmer the mixture gently, stirring occasionally to prevent the rice from sticking to the bottom.
Cook until the rice is fully cooked and the milk thickens (about 30-40 minutes).
Add sugar and stir well until it dissolves completely.
Sprinkle cardamom powder and mix.
In a small pan, heat ghee and fry cashew nuts and raisins until golden brown.
Add the fried nuts and raisins to the payasam as garnish.
Serve warm or chilled.

title: Coconut Milk Pudding
instructions: In a small bowl, mix cornstarch with 1/4 cup of coconut milk to make a smooth slurry.
In a saucepan, combine the remaining coconut milk, sugar, and salt.
Heat the mixture over medium heat until it starts to simmer.
Slowly add the cornstarch slurry to the simmering coconut milk, stirring continuously to avoid lumps.
Continue stirring and cook until the mixture thickens to a pudding-like consistency (about 5-7 minutes).
Remove the pan from heat and stir in the vanilla extract.
Pour the pudding into serving bowls or molds.
Let it cool to room temperature, then refrigerate for at least 2 hours to set.
Before serving, garnish with shredded coconut and toasted coconut flakes if desired.
